body.p: To the Excelence of the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your your Petitioner Morgan Bryant wold Respectible Represent to your Excelence that at the August terme of the Whitley Circuit Court 1863 that the grand jury of Whitley County found an inditement against him for selling liquare as a destillare by the Quarte and permiting it to be drunk on the primises wheare sold but not on the primisesces of the your petitioner your primiseces petitioner says that at the present march terme of the whitley circuit court that he come in to court and plead gilty and the law and facts was submited to the courte and that the courte Rendered a Judgement against him for twenty dollars and that he had no intention of violating the law that at the time of making the sail he acted in good faith beleaving he had a perfect Rite to sell as he did & as soon as he was in formed that he was violating the law that he Quite sellinge and that he prays that your Excelence interpose and pardon and to Remit the fine and to set aside the Judgement and pardon him and for all Proper Releafe
sworn to before me by Morgan Bryant this 19th day of April 1864
C. L. Creekmore P J W C C

The undersigned say that they beleave that the it wold be an act of charity to to Remit the fine and they further say that Bryant is Strictley loyel man and a pore man and has not the means to pay the fine and to mainatin his family and do them Justic and it wold be an act of charity to Remit the fine

C. L. Creekmore P J W C C
A. J. Curd
P. Meadors Dept for J L McCarty S W C
John Smith Justice Jury Fund
J. L. McCarty S. W. C
J. C. Watkins clk

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
Morgan Bryant
These poor loyal men in Whitley have had enough penalties inflicted by rebellion to be excused for selling Whisky & apple Jack. therefore remit except fees & costs
